intro: Smilax brasiliensis var. grisebachii, commonly known as the gray smilax, is a climbing shrub native to South America. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its woody stems and spiny nodes. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers that are often clustered in umbels. Its fruits are berries that turn red when mature, attracting various bird species. This variant is distinguished by its pale greenish hue and is often found in moist, shaded forest understories.
